title: Wimbledon: Coco Gauff crashes out amid day of first-round shocks
subhead: The US second seed came to the All England Club with high hopes after winning the French Open last month but was beaten 7-6 (7/3), 6-1 by Ukrainian world number 42 Dayana Yastremska. Men's third seed Alexander Zverev also bowed out, beaten in five sets by French world number 72 Arthur Rinderknech.

title: In Japan, a manga artist has predicted a disaster in early July, causing a drop in tourism
subhead: The 'prediction' made by a manga author has sparked panic and a decline in bookings around July 5, the day that she claims an earthquake will trigger a massive tsunami. Authorities have reiterated that it is impossible to predict earthquakes.

title: 'Squid Game' season three on Netflix: The epic of Player 456 questions what remains for humanity when hope is gone

title: Rekindled love: 'I passionately fall in love with her and then, like a complete coward, I break her heart'
subhead: They met, fell in love and separated. And then the whirl of life brought them back together. Igor, 61, tells us of his reunion with Gabrielle.

title: The scientists tracking Himalayan glaciers' melting: 'Yala holds a very special place in my heart'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (2/6): The mountain range is home to 54,000 of the planet's 200,000 glaciers, whose accelerating melting threatens locals and worries scientists. Researchers are seeking means for the challenging research expeditions crucial to understanding Nepal's ice masses.
byline: By Carole Dieterich (Yala glacier (Nepal), special correspondent)

title: Anne Deysine, US law expert: 'We are experiencing the dawn of a lawless society'
subhead: In an interview, Anne Deysine, a US law specialist, explains that the US Supreme Court's June 27 ruling would lead to institutional 'chaos,' as Trump is now able to keep changing US institutions and society through his executive orders, which are often illegal.
